doc.after: On August 18 1920 Tennessee became the thirty sixth and final state necessary to ratify the Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution which provided women the right to vote Disfranchising voter registration requirements continued to keep most African Americans and many poor whites both men and women off the voter rolls
